import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt                #import libraries
import  numpy as pd
source.14e5e9fd:
#We have numerous of people who are have some specific blood_type and we want to analys them by our goal immagination.
People_Count = [30, 24, 8 ,38]          
Blood_Type = ['A', 'B', 'AB', 'O']
Ouroverviewdata = plt.figure(figsize= (10,5), dpi=70)
OurFigure= Ouroverviewdata.add_axes([0 , 0, 1, 1])
OurFigure.bar(Blood_Type,People_Count )                          #for this type of data_set we should us 'bar chart' to define data in better way to our people,customer, etc.
OurFigure.set_title('Number of people with different type of blood', fontsize=15)
OurFigure.set_xlabel('Number of people', fontsize=13)
OurFigure.set_ylabel('Blood Type', fontsize=13)
plt.show()
source.348b5faf:
#Drawing Pie Chart for our data
Ouroverviewdata, OurFigure = plt.subplots()
Mylabels= ['A', 'B', 'AB', 'O']
Atypeblood=[0.09, 0.09, 0.09, 0.09]
OurFigure.pie(People_Count, labels=Mylabels, radius=2, startangle=10, explode=Atypeblood, shadow=True)
plt.legend(title= 'Guide')
plt.show()

source.cbbfea07:
#We wan to draw a histogram wich have 300 sample with normal distribution and with mean of 170 and with Standard deviation 10 (In this case after we import numpy library we us 'np.random.normal' function to process normaly data we want, and we shoud write our number in ordinaly (first: 'mean', second: 'Standard deviation' third: 'sample'))
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
OurRandomData= np.random.normal(170, 10, 300)
plt.hist(OurRandomData, color='#2ca02c')
plt.show()
